description: Often, a soldier would carry a secondary weapon in addition to his primary weapon of choice, to be drawn when the primary weapon has failed or been broken. The Persians Akīnakah was side arm that had a long triangular blade. Akīnakah were prized weapons, some gilded in gold and studded with jewels. It was written that the Persian king would gift such valuable daggers to members of the military who had exhibited great valor or had pleased him in some way.
tooltip: All Melee units +1 hack attack. (TODO: Make this also unlock a defensive melee attack for ranged units)
